about_the_game:
Story Overview


Enter a desolate megastructure, given the codename 'Garganta', which houses a cataclysmic device putting the Universe at risk. Embody Servo, a highly advanced android capable of traversing the dilapidated construct.

Players will find that the only signs of life in the megastructure are various sapient machines. Their existences are oftentimes hellish, becoming trapped in mundane objects with no voice with which to cry out, no identity to cling to. Some may try to help, though others have intentions beyond your comprehension.

You will be ironclad, running, climbing and jumping your way across this world without reason. So that you may come to The End, and forge your own purpose in the crucible of singularity.

Key Features


  • High-Octane Parkour Gameplay

  • Immersive, Explorable World

  • Oppressive, Industrial Art

  • Mysterious Narrative

  • Secrets Scattered Across The World

  • Online Leaderboards

The Developers


Originally the capstone project of 4 RMIT students from Melbourne, Garganta became a fully developed indie game, eventually being displayed at PAX Melbourne 2023.

Our goal was simple, we wanted to make a visually compelling game, paying special homage to the works of Tsutomu Nihei, especially Blame!, which served as one of our biggest inspirations for the environments of the game.

content_descriptors.notes: Mature themes such as death and existential dread discussed. No course language or profanity is used at all. The main character, who is a robot, often gets destroyed and rebuilt, however, there is no blood or explicit violence is depicted.

short_description: 'Garganta' is a 3D Platformer influenced by Tsutomu Nihei's works. Embody Servo, an android racing to neutralise a device that'll engulf the Universe in innumerable singularities. Encounter peculiar characters and unveil secret plots designed by an AI, maddened by incomprehensible horrors.
